class.name: JavaElementHandler
class.javadoc:
This class is intended to handle <java> element. Each element that appears in the body of this element is evaluated in the context of the decoder itself. Typically this outer context is used to retrieve the owner of the decoder, which can be set before reading the archive.

The following atributes are supported:

version
the Java version (not supported)
class
the type of preferable parser (not supported)
id
the identifier of the variable that is intended to store the result
DocumentHandler#getOwner DocumentHandler#setOwner 1.7 Sergey A. Malenkov

Parses attributes of the element. The following atributes are supported: <dl> <dt>version <dd>the Java version (not supported) <dt>class <dd>the type of preferable parser (not supported) <dt>id <dd>the identifier of the variable that is intended to store the result </dl>
name the attribute name
value the attribute value

Adds the argument to the list of readed objects.
argument the value of the element that contained in this one

Tests whether the value of this element can be used as an argument of the element that contained in this one.
{@code true} if the value of this element should be used as an argument of the element that contained in this one,{@code false} otherwise

Returns the value of this element.
the value of this element

Returns the owner of the owner document handler as a value of <java> element.
the owner of the owner document handler

Validates the owner of the <java> element. The owner is valid if it is {@code null} or an instance of the class specified by the {@code class} attribute.
owner the owner of the <java> element
{@code true} if the {@code owner} is valid;{@code false} otherwise
